relation: configure terminal Example: Router# configure terminal
interface type number Example: Router(config)# interface Ethernet 0/0
ipv6 nd secured trustpoint trustpoint-name Example: Router(config-if)# ipv6 nd secured trustpoint trustpoint1
no ipv6 nd secured full-secure Example: Router(config-if)# no ipv6 nd secured full-secure
Enables privileged EXEC mode. Enter your password if prompted.
Specifies an interface type and number, and places the router in interface configuration mode.
Enables SeND on an interface and specifies which trustpoint should be used.
Provides the coexistence mode for secure and nonsecure ND messages on the same interface.
pageTitle: IPv6 Implementation Guide, Cisco IOS Release 15.2S - Implementing First Hop Security in IPv6 [Cisco IOS 15.2S] - Cisco
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {139409=Router(config)# crypto key generate rsa label SEND modulus 1024, 112897=Host(config)# crypto key generate rsa label SEND modulus 1024}
textBeforeTable: DETAILED STEPS 5.    no ipv6 nd secured full-secure 4.    ipv6 nd secured trustpoint trustpoint-name 3.    interface type number 2.    configure terminal 1.    enable SUMMARY STEPS During the transition to SeND secured interfaces, network operators may want to run a particular interface with a mixture of nodes accepting secured and unsecured neighbor discovery messages. Perform this task to configure the coexistence mode for secure and nonsecure ND messages on the same interface. Configuring Secured and Nonsecured Neighbor Discovery Message Coexistence Mode Specifies a trusted anchor on an interface and binds SeND to a trustpoint.   Router(config-if)# ipv6 nd secured trustanchor anchor1   Example: ipv6 nd secured trustanchor trustanchor-name Step 8 Specifies an
textAfterTable: Configuring SeND Parameters Globally SUMMARY STEPS 1.    enable 2.    configure terminal 3.    ipv6 nd secured key-length [[minimum| maximum] value] 4.    ipv6 nd secured sec-level minimum value DETAILED STEPS   Command or Action Purpose Step 1 enable Example: Router> enable   Enables privileged EXEC mode. Enter your password if prompted.   Step 2 configure terminal Example: Router# configure terminal   Enters global configuration mode.   Step 3
